intro: Echinocystis racemosa, commonly known as the horsehead vine, is a climbing plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is a thick-walled, spiny capsule that contains several seeds.
